bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District } ss

Be at remmembered that on this first day of May AD 1885 before be James G Swan a Commissiones of the District Court of this Unites States in and for said district personally came Tokewar or Billy. Kleachton a Annie and Frank a Banllett who acknowledge the custody to one and be indebted to the United States of America in the full and just sworn of fifty dollars to be loved on their goods chattls lands and tenomands and the United States of defendants be made in the conditions following.

The coditions of this remmand are such that if this attraction Tokwad and Kleachton shall personally appear before the United States District Court Fourth 3rd Judicial District building terms at Pory Townsend at te martinterm thereof on the first day of said there to be begon and holdon on tho fomth somefay of Agust AD 1885 in said district then and there to testify on behalf of the United States in a cause where in the said United States is plaintiff and Leonard Martin is defendant and shall notify anytime be absent or depart orm said court whithin leve than this very to be vaoid otherwise to remain in full force and virtue

In teritorry where of the otligns have
sset trer hands and seals the day and year other within
